text.text_translated:
Wild dogs live in Moscow. This is interesting.
About 35,000 wild dogs live on the streets there.
Some dogs were born wild.
Other dogs were pets. Their owners left them.
Some dogs live alone. Other dogs live in groups.
In 2010, scientists studied the dogs.
They saw the dogs learned to live in the city very well. This was a big success.
The dogs learned it is safer to cross the street with people.
Some dogs seem to understand traffic lights.

feedback.feedback: PASS: The text successfully meets all A2 readability requirements. It maintains factual integrity, preserves the core meaning, and adheres to the specified CEFR level. The MeaningBERT score of 0.7918 and BERTScore of 0.9297 are well within the acceptable range. The CEFR classifier correctly identified the text as A2. Vocabulary is consistently at the A1/A2 level, with no detected B1 or higher words. Sentence structures are short and simple, avoiding complex clauses or advanced connectors. The simplification of 'adapted remarkably successfully to urban life' to 'learned to live in the city very well. This was a big success.' is an excellent example of A2-level rephrasing.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Wild dogs live in Moscow. This is interesting.
About 35,000 wild dogs live on the streets there.
Some dogs were born wild.
Other dogs were pets. Their owners left them.
Some dogs live alone. Other dogs live in groups.
In 2010, scientists studied the dogs.
They saw the dogs learned to live in the city very well. This was a big success.
The dogs learned it is safer to cross the street with people.
Some dogs seem to understand traffic lights.
